discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In the RE Framework without Orchestrator, the MaxRetryNumber in the Config.xlsx file determines the number of retries for a transaction in case of a System Exception.
Setting this value to greater than 0 ensures the framework handles retries automatically when a transaction fails.

choices.C: Use a Try Catch activity with a Retry Scope activity in the Catch block defined for System Exceptions
choices.A: Create a queue in Orchestrator with the "Max# of retries" greater than 0
choices.D: Use a Retry Scope activity within the Process Transaction state
choices.B: Set the MaxRetryNumber in the Config.xlsx file to a number greater than 0

questions.question_text: A process uses the Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework without access to Orchestrator. Based on best practices, what is the recommended way to ensure a transaction will be retried in the event of a System Exception while processing that transaction?

discussion.content: send window message and simulate click both cannot be set to true simultaneously , so only simulate click will be set to true as it is the fastest and works in the background, the private property should set to be true too for sensitive data and wait for ready should be set to complete.

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-

A developer is building a process which scrapes sensitive structured data from an application. The process needs to meet the following requirements:

1. Wait for the entire application to load
2. Hide the sensitive data when the Verbose logging level is set
3. Must work on a background window
4. Must use the fastest input method

Instructions: From the drop-down list and check boxes shown in the following exhibit, set the properties for the Data Scraping activity to ensure they meet the requirements described above.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the correct ans .

Selected Answer: B
I think the correct answer is B !

choices.B: The activity will use Default in Run mode and SendWindowMessages in Debug mode.
choices.D: The activity will use SendWindowMessages in Run mode and Default in Debug Mode.
choices.A: The activity will use SendWindowMessages in Run mode and in Debug mode.
choices.C: The activity will use Default in Run mode and in Debug mode.
